I am Wei Jie, an undergraduate student at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), studying Applied Computing with a focus on data and analytics.
This website showcases my academic work, projects, and reflections as part of my Data Engineering module.

title: Project
text:
Before entering SIT, I studied Banking and Finance and worked on an entrepreneurship project. My team built a prototype of a crypto platform called ‚ÄúCryptogenics‚Äù that aimed at educating the masses on cryptocurrencies and how to manage their investments.



Objective: Educate the public on cryptocurrency
Tools used: Figma
Outcome: Interviewed 50 members of the public and received feedback that 70% would try our app

title: Project
text:
Before entering SIT, I studied Banking and Finance and worked on an entrepreneurship project. My team built a prototype of a crypto platform called ‚ÄúCryptogenics‚Äù that aimed at educating the masses on cryptocurrencies and how to manage their investments.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Visualization: Portfolio vs Benchmark Performance
This visualization presents a cumulative return line chart comparing the performance of my backtested investment portfolio against a benchmark ETF over the period 2019 to 2025. The portfolio is constructed using a diversified basket of exchange-traded funds (ETFs) with fixed weights, while the benchmark represents broad market performance.
By plotting cumulative returns over time, the chart allows for a direct comparison of how an actively constructed portfolio performs relative to a passive market reference across multiple market cycles.

What this chart shows
The portfolio consistently outperforms the benchmark over the long run, achieving higher cumulative returns by the end of the period.
Periods of market stress and volatility (such as sharp drawdowns) are clearly visible, allowing comparison of how both the portfolio and benchmark react during downturns.
The visualization highlights the speed and strength of recovery, showing that the portfolio rebounds more effectively than the benchmark after market declines.
Overall performance differences become increasingly pronounced over time, illustrating the impact of portfolio construction decisions on long-term outcomes.


Why I chose this visualization
I chose a cumulative return line chart because it is the most intuitive and widely used method for evaluating investment performance over time:

It clearly represents long-term growth trajectories rather than short-term fluctuations.
It enables direct, like-for-like comparison between two investment strategies on the same scale.
It makes drawdowns, volatility, and recovery periods visually apparent, which are critical aspects of portfolio analysis.

This form of visualization is commonly used in professional finance and investment research, making it appropriate for communicating results clearly and effectively.


Key takeaway
Based on this backtest, the portfolio demonstrates stronger long-term performance compared to the benchmark, indicating that diversification and asset allocation choices can meaningfully enhance returns. However, the chart also shows that the portfolio experiences periods of volatility, reinforcing the importance of evaluating performance alongside risk rather than focusing solely on returns.
This visualization highlights the trade-off between risk and reward, which is a central concept in portfolio management and investment decision-making.



Portfolio Construction




Portfolio Construction (Context for the Visualization)
The results shown in the visualization are generated from a backtesting system that allows users to: - Select a time period for analysis - Define the number of ETFs and their respective weights - Compare portfolio performance against a chosen benchmark
This context is important because the visualization reflects not only market movements, but also the underlying assumptions and design choices made during portfolio construction.



Portfolio AI Review




Portfolio AI Review
This section presents an AI-generated review of the backtested portfolio based on its historical performance metrics, asset allocation, and risk characteristics. The AI analyzes quantitative indicators such as cumulative return, volatility, drawdowns, and individual ETF contributions to provide an interpretive summary of the portfolio‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses.
Rather than generating new numerical results, the AI serves as a decision-support tool, helping to contextualize the data shown in the visualization and translate technical metrics into actionable insights.


How the AI review complements the visualization
The AI review complements the portfolio performance chart in several ways:

It interprets performance trends observed in the cumulative return visualization, such as sustained outperformance or periods of heightened volatility.
It highlights risk considerations that may not be immediately obvious from the chart alone, including concentration risk or sensitivity to market downturns.
It provides qualitative insights that help bridge the gap between raw numerical data and investment decision-making.

Together, the visualization and AI review offer a more complete understanding of portfolio behavior than either component alone.


Key takeaway
The AI review reinforces the insights derived from the visualization by emphasizing that strong returns should always be evaluated alongside risk and portfolio composition. While the portfolio demonstrates favorable long-term performance, the review highlights the importance of understanding underlying assumptions, market exposure, and risk trade-offs when interpreting backtesting results.
This section illustrates how AI can support more informed, data-driven decisions when used responsibly and in conjunction with clear visual evidence.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
The primary GenAI tool I used for this assignment was ChatGPT to support the development and refinement of my personal website and content. The tool was not used to generate results or visualizations automatically, but rather to assist with structuring, explanation, and presentation of my existing work.
I chose this tool because it is effective at explaining technical concepts clearly, improving the structure of written content, and suggesting refinements in wording while preserving the original meaning.
As this assignment involved both technical work and reflective writing, ChatGPT was suitable as a support tool to help communicate my ideas more clearly.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:

The tool was not used to generate results or visualizations automatically, but rather to assist with structuring, explanation, and presentation of my existing work.
I chose this tool because it is effective at explaining technical concepts clearly, improving the structure of written content, and suggesting refinements in wording while preserving the original meaning.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: How GenAI helped me complete the assessment
text:
How GenAI helped me complete the assessment
GenAI supported my work in several practical ways:

It helped refine explanations for my data visualization, especially in explaining the rationale behind performance metrics and design choices.
It assisted in structuring content across different pages of the website, ensuring consistency and clarity.
It helped me verify that my content aligned with the assessment requirements, reducing the risk of missing key components.

The quantitative analysis, portfolio backtesting logic, and visualizations were created using my own systems and prior projects. GenAI was used only to polish presentation and explanations, not to generate results.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Benefits of using GenAI
One major benefit of GenAI is efficiency. It allows ideas to be refined quickly and helps transform technical explanations into clearer, more readable content.
It also serves as a second perspective when reviewing work, which is helpful for improving structure and identifying areas that need clarification.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Challenges and limitations of GenAI
GenAI has several limitations:

It may produce generic responses if prompts are not specific.
It does not fully understand project context unless detailed information is provided.
Outputs must always be reviewed for accuracy and relevance.

Because of this, I treated GenAI as a supporting assistant, not a replacement for my own judgment or understanding.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: How GenAI may assist me in future study or work
text:
How GenAI may assist me in future study or work
In future academic and professional work, I expect GenAI to be useful for: - drafting documentation and explanations, - summarizing technical concepts, - supporting reflection and ideation.
However, strong domain knowledge and critical thinking will remain essential, especially in data analytics and finance-related work.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Additional thoughts
This experience reinforced the importance of using GenAI responsibly. When used transparently and thoughtfully, it can enhance productivity and communication without compromising learning or originality.
